sen.e: Tokinobu ROKKAKU (1306 - September 17, 1346) was a samrai (warrior) who lived in the Kamakura Period and the Nanbokucho Period (Southern and Northern Court Period).

sen.j: 元弘元年（1331年）、後醍醐天皇が内裏を脱出して笠木山に挙兵した元弘の乱では鎌倉幕府方に従い鎮圧に加わり、六波羅探題軍に加わり山門東坂本に攻め寄せており、捕縛された一宮尊良親王を預かっている。
sen.e: In 1331, on the occasion of the Genko Incident (abortive coup of Genko) in which the Emperor Godaigo escaped from the dairi (imperial palace) and raised an army in Mt. Kasagi-yama, he joined the troop of the Kamakura bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun) to suppress and he also joined the troop of the Rokuhara tandai (agent of the Kamakura bakufu stationed in Rokuhara, Kyoto) and closed in on Sanmon Higashi Sakamoto and took on the care of Ichinomiya (first prince), Imperial Prince Takayoshi [Takanaga] who was captured.

sen.j: 元弘3年（1333年）、後醍醐天皇流罪後も続いた反乱軍鎮圧では、摂津天王寺に戦陣している。
sen.e: In 1333, on the occasion of suppression of rebels that continued even after the Emperor Godaigo was exiled, he went to the front in Settsu Tennoji.
